communications.subject: Biscom DOHMH Delivery Data Servicestk@publishmeasap.com
communications.communication:
An account was requested on your behalf Samantha Bynoe by New York City Department of Health.



Your account has been created and you should receive an email with the credentials. Attached here is a small guide to help you along.



This service is used to send and/or receive files from/to an employee at the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.







DOHMH Data Delivery Service User Guide



This guide is an introduction to using the DOHMH Delivery Service (DDS) also known as Biscom.  DDS enables the secure delivery of files, documents and other electronic information while providing tracking and reporting capabilities.





DDS secure file transfer involves three simple steps:

1.   Create a package of files and deliver it to a pre-approved external email address.

2.   Recipients are notified of their secure delivery in an email message.

(Recipients must have an account in this system otherwise they will not be able to get files)

3.   Recipient signs into DDS, retrieves the package and downloads the file(s).





Definitions

Package: A file or collection of files uploaded to the DDS system.

Delivery: An email that links recipients to a package - packages that are created can be delivered.

Express Delivery: A way for Senders to upload files and deliver them in a single step (package creation and delivery are combined).

Sender: A user who has been approved to send files to one or more recipients.

Recipient: A authorized user who can receive files and reply to deliveries but cannot send their own files.





Logging in for the First time:



  1.  You will receive an email with the credentials from notify@a816-healthpsi.nyc.gov<mailto:notify@a816-healthpsi.nyc.gov> and the link that will take you to the login page.

That link is to always be used when using this system, so please bookmark it.



  1.  The email will look like the image below. Click on the link in the email to get the login page.

Enter your username and password.

Please note: Do not copy and paste the password, please type in each character



[cid:image001.jpg@01D91078.8B89BCC0]





  1.  Once logged in you will be immediately asked to change your password.

Once done you will be asked to re-login using the new password.



This is the policy for accounts:

If an account is inactive for 45 days, it will automatically be expired.

First inactivity warning is 14 days prior; Second inactivity warning is 7 days prior.

You must login at least once every 45 days to keep your account active.



This is the policy for passwords:

Password is valid for 90 days

Password Expiration warning is sent 7 days prior

Passwords must contain at least one of each



              The password must meet these requirements. It must have a least one from each a section:

                                           Uppercase letters:                               A - Z

Lowercase letters:                               a - z

Digits:                                                    0 - 9

Non-alphanumeric characters:     ~ , < , { , + ,  etc.

Password must be at minimum 8 characters (maximum is 50 characters)



  1.  Please setup your security questions which helps in case you forget your password.

You can do this by clicking on Personal settings on the top right of the screen then selecting Edit Profile

You will see the Fields for Password reset Question please enter your question and answer, then select update.



            Please note: You cannot reuse the same password you previously had.





Instructions for Sending Files:



To send one or more files, you must have the Sender role assigned to you. As a Sender, you will see the

 Express Delivery icon and link in the main menu.



[cid:image002.png@01D91078.8B89BCC0]





  1.  Click this link or icon to open the delivery screen.





[cid:image003.png@01D91078.8B89BCC0]



2.  Enter the email addresses of your recipients in the To field

3.   Enter a subject or topic in the Subject field.

4.   Drag and drop files into the files box or click the Add file button to open a file chooser dialog.

5.   Optional: enter a secure message.

6.   Optional: Click the Show options link to expand the delivery and enter an email notification message, and additional delivery options.

7.   Click the Send button to upload your files and send an email notification message to the recipients.





Replying to a Delivery:

Recipients can reply to a secure delivery they've received by clicking on the Show/Hide Reply Section link at the bottom of the delivery. A secure message and one or more files can be sent back to the original sender of the message.



Retrieving Files:

Recipients of secure deliveries receive a non-secure email in their email inbox. This email contains a notification message and an embedded hyperlink. Clicking the hyperlink will bring the recipient to the DDS application sign-in page, and once the recipient provides their username and password, the recipient will have access to their delivery.



Notice:

This secure data transfer system is the property of the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene and is intended for business purposes only. You have no right to privacy on the system, and all information and activity on the system may be monitored.  Any illegal or unauthorized use of the system may result in disciplinary action and/or civil or criminal penalties.

Your use of the system constitutes express consent to the above terms and conditions.









Regards, Tyler Bennett.

Sent from the New York City Department of Health & Mental Hygiene. This email and any files transmitted with it may contain confidential information and are intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. This footnote also confirms that this email message has been swept for the presence of computer viruses.

communications.subject: FOIL Control No. 2023FR02147 response
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Riccio:

My apologies for the delay.  The NYC Department of Health grants your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request with the above-referenced control number. Based on the size of the response file, records will be sent to you shortly via BISCOM. If you have issues with opening the file, please let me know.

Records have been withheld for the following reasons:

  1.  they are inter-agency or intra-agency materials pursuant to FOIL §87(2)(g); or
  2.  their disclosure would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy pursuant to FOIL §§ 87(2)(b) and 89(2)(b); or
  3.  they are exempt from disclosure pursuant to FOIL §87(2)(a); or
  4.  their disclosure would jeopardize the capacity of the Health Department to guarantee the security of its information technology assets pursuant to FOIL §87(2)(i).

In addition, redactions were made to records which were not responsive to your request.

You may file a written appeal of this determination within 30 days of the date of this message.  The appeal should be addressed to:
Chari Anhouse
Associate General Counsel and Records Access Appeals Officer
Email: recordsaccess@health.nyc.gov<mailto:recordsaccess@health.nyc.gov>

The notice of appeal should include the request control number, the date of this message, a description of the records that were the subject of the request, the specific legal grounds for your appeal, and the full name and email address of the original requester.

Sincerely,


Bernadette O'Donnell
Records Access Officer / Associate General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene - City of New York
42-09 28th St., Long Island City, NY 11101
Email: bodonnell1@health.nyc.gov<mailto:bodonnell1@health.nyc.gov> | nyc.gov/health<https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/index.page>

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: staff list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

a complete list of DHCR employees, including name, title, salary, and length of employment
a complete list of DHCR vacancies, including title, salary, and date of the vacancy's beginning

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:

communications.subject: DHCR/HTFC Records Request :: D000235-071123
communications.communication:
Dear Sam Mellins: 
This message confirms receipt of your request. Your request was received in this office on 7/11/2023 and given the reference number D000235-071123 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

a complete list of DHCR employees, including name, title, salary, and length of employment
a complete list of DHCR vacancies, including title, salary, and date of the vacancy's beginning

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnew-york-state-division-of-homes-and-community-renewal-5559%252Fstaff-list-149121%252F%253Femail%253DORAFOIL%252540nyshcr.org&url_auth_token=AAAWUraMCX4VTr6410eu2oxl958%3A1qJPk4%3AMiav5VLCYIL7ZLLU9s0Ki7icIOnnQSC8bfNnlns23Jk 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
NYS Homes and Community Renewal

a complete list of DHCR employees, including name, title, salary, and length of employment

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnew-york-state-division-of-homes-and-community-renewal-5559%252Fstaff-list-149121%252F%253Femail%253DORAFOIL%252540nyshcr.org&url_auth_token=AAAWUraMCX4VTr6410eu2oxl958%3A1qJPk4%3AMiav5VLCYIL7ZLLU9s0Ki7icIOnnQSC8bfNnlns23Jk" Pursuant to POL§ 89(3), the New York State Division of Housing and Community Renewal (“DHCR”) has twenty (20) business days to respond to your request. The New York State Division of Housing and Community Renewal (“DHCR”) is continuing to compile and review records which may be potentially responsive to the above-referenced FOIL request. However, please be advised that DHCR needs additional time to review our records and respond to your request. Pursuant to FOIL § 89(3), DHCR is extending the time to respond by an additional 20 business days to complete your FOIL request. By the end of this twenty-day period, we will (i) notify you that we have found no responsive documents, (ii) complete our review and produce responsive documents to you, OR (iii) provide an updated estimate of the time needed to review the collected documents for responsiveness and exemptions. Please be advised that some of the requested information may not exist in the form specified by you. Sincerely,

Please be advised that some of the requested information may not exist in the form specified by you. Dear Sam Mellins, 
This is regarding your above-referenced FOIL request. The New York State Division of Housing and Community Renewal (“DHCR”) is continuing to compile and review records which may be potentially responsive to the above-referenced FOIL request. However, please be advised that DHCR needs additional time to review our records and respond to your request. Pursuant to FOIL § 89(3), DHCR is extending the time to respond by an additional 20 business days to complete your FOIL request. By the end of this twenty-day period, we will (i) notify you that we have found no responsive documents, (ii) complete our review and produce responsive documents to you, OR (iii) provide an updated estimate of the time needed to review the collected documents for responsiveness and exemptions. The anticipated date of response is August 16, 2024. 
At that time, if the documents are available in electronic format and do not require more than two hours of employee time to reproduce, we will e-mail them to you free of charge. If reproduction of records requires that you be charged for their reproduction, we will inform you of that cost before providing you with the records. 
Please be advised that some of the requested information may not exist in the form specified by you. communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!

communications.subject: Re: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Maryland on the job death claims (Maryland Occupational Safety And Health (mosh) - Division Of Labor And Industry)
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for the email. In the future, please send public information act
requests to mosh.mpia@maryland.gov. The email address has been copied on
this response.

Thank you,

[image: Maryland Department of Labor]
Maryland Occupational Safety and Health (MOSH)
Maryland Department of Labor
10946 Golden West Drive, Suite 160
Hunt Valley, MD 21031
mosh.complaints@maryland.gov
410-527-4499 (O)
410-527-4488 (F)
Website <https://www.labor.maryland.gov/> | Facebook
<https://www.facebook.com/MarylandLabor> | Twitter
<https://twitter.com/MD_Labor>

Click here to complete a three-question customer experience survey
<http://www.doit.state.md.us/selectsurvey/TakeSurvey.aspx?agencycode=DLLR&SurveyID=86M2956>

Confidentiality Notice. The information contained in this communication
(including any attachments) (a) is or may be legally privileged,
confidential, proprietary in nature, or otherwise protected by law from
disclosure; and (b) is intended only for the use of the addressee(s) named
herein. If you are not the intended recipient, an addressee, or the person
responsible for delivering this to an addressee, you are hereby notified
that reading, using, copying, or distributing any part of this message is
strictly prohibited. If you have received this electronic mail message in
error, please contact me immediately and take the steps necessary to delete
the message completely from your computer system. Thank you.

We recently received a PIA request for Any investigative/incident reports concerning on the job deaths reported in the State of Maryland between January 1, 2020 through December 31, 2023.  I would like to request clarification of this request.  Are you asking for work related fatalities where an inspection was conducted, or are you looking for all fatalities reported to MOSH (i.e. are you wanting information that turned out not to be work-related like heart attacks and motor vehicle accidents where no inspection was conducted)?

This type of request is going to take considerable time and there maybe a fee involved due to the amount of background investigative efforts.  Once further clarification is received, we can than advise of the fee and proceed with this request.  Please send reply to mosh.mpia@maryland.gov.

Thank you

Victoria Flowers

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

In response to your recent MPIA request received on April 5, 2024, we can
provide you with 26 case files between the dates of January 1, 2020 and
December 31, 2023 within the next 2 weeks.  There are an additional 69 case
files we can provide between those dates and our fee for that information
will be $2,156.25.

Should this fee be acceptable, please respond by Friday April 12, 2024.  We
can provide you with an invoice and payment form and once payment has been
received, we can begin gathering the additional case files for you.

Thank You,

[image: Changing Maryland for the Better]
<http://www.labor.maryland.gov/images/changingmd.png>

*MOSH MPIA Requests*

Hunt Valley, MD 21031

mosh.mpia@maryland.gov  <mosh.mpia@maryland.gov>

-- 
Thank You,

communications.subject: MPIA request Log 24-052
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Lowery,

MOSH received your payment of $2,156.25 for the additional 69 investigation
reports related to job deaths which occurred in the State of Maryland
between January 1, 2020 and December 31, 2023.

 MOSH will begin review and preparation of the records for release.  MOSH
anticipates this will take several weeks.   Please let me know if you have
any questions.

-- 
Thank You,

[image: Changing Maryland for the Better]
<http://www.labor.maryland.gov/images/changingmd.png>

*MOSH MPIA Requests*

*Maryland Public Information *

Maryland Occupational Safety and Health

Maryland Department of Labor

10946 Golden West Drive, Suite 160

Hunt Valley, MD 21031

mosh.mpia@maryland.gov  <mosh.mpia@maryland.gov>

*MD Labor Website:* http://www.labor.maryland.gov/

communications.subject: Log 24-052 MPIA Request (see attachment for release letter)
communications.communication:
Dear Requester ,


   You should receive an email from Taxtran from “Victoria Flowers” which
will include your files from your MPIA request for records related to
Request 24-052 received on July 19, 2024.

     Attached with this email you will find a release letter.  Due to the
large volume of requested files and resources necessary to prepare the
files for release, MOSH will be providing the requested records in batches
every 10 to 12 days until the requested is completed.
If MOSH can be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us
at mosh.mpia@maryland.gov.



-- 
Thank You,

[image: Changing Maryland for the Better]
<http://www.labor.maryland.gov/images/changingmd.png>

communications.subject: New Package Notification
communications.communication:
New Package Notification

A package has been posted for you.

"Dear Requester,

Pursuant to your Maryland Public Information Act (MPIA) request, the records you requested are now available. In accordance with the MPIA, Part III and IV of the General Provisions Article (“GP”), Annotated Code, §4-101 et seq., the following information has been withheld:

Personal identifying information including home addresses and personal cell phone numbers of employees have been redacted for privacy reasons. 

Attorney client privilege.  This information is privileged and confidential under GP §4-301.

Should you disagree with the withholding of the above-listed information, the following remedies are available:

 1. You may pursue judicial enforcement remedies by filing a complaint with the Circuit Court in accordance with GP §4-362. 


 2.   In addition, Pursuant to GP § 4-362, you are entitled to seek judicial review of this decision. Alternatively, you may file a request for mediation with the Public Access Ombudsman and, if the Ombudsman is unable to resolve the matter, may subsequently seek a resolution from the Public Information Act Compliance Board for those matters within the Compliance Board's jurisdiction.  See GP §§ 4-1A-01 et seq. and 4-1B-01 et seq.

  

Due to the large volume of requested  files  and resources necessary to prepare the files for release, MOSH will be providing the requested records in batches every 10 to 12 days until the request is completed.


If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at mosh.mpia@maryland.gov.


Sincerely,


Victoria Flowers

Administrative Assistant

Division of Labor and Industry

Maryland Department of Labor

10946 Golden West Drive | Suite 160

Hunt Valley, Maryland 21031

Victoria.Flowers@maryland.gov

410-527-2076 phone"

title: Code Enforcement's Refusal to Enforce Laws Requiring Deadbolts at the Baltimore Hotel owned by-AIDS Healthcare Foundation

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Code Enforcement's Refusal to Enforce Laws Requiring Deadbolts at the Baltimore Hotel owned by-AIDS Healthcare Foundation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all notes, entries, photos, videos, reports, complaints, emails, text messages, and other communications, concerning the following:

1.Code Enforcement Complaint #897099, filed April 30, 2024, in which a tenant complained he did not have a deadbolt, and more than 100 other units at the AIDS Healthcare Foundation's Baltimore Hotel did not have deadbolts
2. Inspector Tony Robles noted that on May 9, 2024, he went to the Baltimore and spoke with the complaining tenant, and took photos.  Please provide all of those notes, documents, photos or videos.
3. All communications regarding the February 2022 inspection by Tony Robles of the Baltimore, during which he noted over 100 violations for lack of deadbolts, but James Heiberg said to delete those violations. 
4. All communications between anyone from Code Enforcement and anyone at AIDS Healthcare Foundation, regarding the deadbolts at the Baltimore.  This is including but not limited to the text messages and emails that Robert Gilardi kindly sends to Mark Dyer rather than issuing a Notice to Comply. This includes communications between Code Enforcement on the one hand, and on the other hand,  AHF's: Mark Dyer, Michael Weinstein, Jonathan Eisenberg, Tom Myers, Conrad Sison, Beatrice Di Marco, Dominique Eastman, Herbert Ellis,  Juan Larios.
5. Any discussion (including emails, text messages, memos, notes) between any Code Enforcement employee, (including but not limited to James Heiberg, Robert Gilardi, Tony Robles, Ann Sewill, etc.), that includes any of the following terms: "1941.3" "deadbolt" "dead bolt" "91.8607" "door lock" "91.8607" and/or "897099." 
6. Any discussion between any Code Enforcement employee, about why it decided to exclude the exact complaint language from the publicly accessible Property Activity Report on complaint #897099.
7. Any emails with the subject line "Complaint # 897099 / Baltimore Hotel / Carlos Brum/ Lack of Deadbolts"

This public records act request is not limited to the custodian of records simply forwarding this request to the named individuals here. This request demands that the custodian of records actually contact its IT department and conduct a search with the specific parameters and search terms. This request demands electronic copies of these records in their native format, and not printed out and scanned.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Annette Morasch

communications.communication:
These records do not include any of the attachments to the emails. As just one example, the email from Mark Dyer to the City dated 2/12/2024 has several attachments which were not produced. (See attached.) None of the emails which show they have attachments were produced with the attachments. 
These records also do not include any of the following requested documents:

2. Inspector Tony Robles noted that on May 9, 2024, he went to the Baltimore and spoke with the complaining tenant, and took photos. Please provide all of those notes, documents, photos or videos.
3. All communications regarding the February 2022 inspection by Tony Robles of the Baltimore, during which he noted over 100 violations for lack of deadbolts, but James Heiberg said to delete those violations.
4. All communications between anyone from Code Enforcement and anyone at AIDS Healthcare Foundation, regarding the deadbolts at the Baltimore. This is including but not limited to the text messages and emails that Robert Gilardi kindly sends to Mark Dyer rather than issuing a Notice to Comply. This includes communications between Code Enforcement on the one hand, and on the other hand, AHF's: Mark Dyer, Michael Weinstein, Jonathan Eisenberg, Tom Myers, Conrad Sison, Beatrice Di Marco, Dominique Eastman, Herbert Ellis, Juan Larios.
5. Any discussion (including emails, text messages, memos, notes) between any Code Enforcement employee, (including but not limited to James Heiberg, Robert Gilardi, Tony Robles, Ann Sewill, etc.), that includes any of the following terms: "1941.3" "deadbolt" "dead bolt" "91.8607" "door lock" "91.8607" and/or "897099."

Documents have been redacted without reason. I understand why you woudl redact tenant contact information (which you did for some, but not others). But there are whole chunks of communications redacted without saying who was involved in the redacted communication. Thus the majority of my requests were ignored by the  City. 

Conclusion. If I do not receive a fully compliant response to my PRA, we will file a writ of mandate and seek attorneys' fees on August 19, 2024.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Truancy Letter, Notices
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Per the CPS Comprehensive Policy on Attendance (Section 703.1, Board Report 22-0622-PO1), Section II, paragraph B (a):

"Schools must send a letter notifying a student’s family of 5 unexcused absences, and, subsequently, 10 unexcused absences. 10 day letters of unexcused absence notification are to be sent certified, return receipt requested."

In FOIA N014933-022924, the District indicates, "Be advised that while there is a system in place that advises schools of students who have had 5-day and 10-day unexcused absences, the correspondence that is to be sent out to parents is the responsibility of individual schools."

1. Provide a blank template letter for the 5 day unexcused absence letter;
2. Provide a blank template letter for the 10 day unexcused absence letter;
3. Provide records sufficient to show copies of 5 Days Unexcused Absence letters issued in SY 2023/2024;
4. Provide records sufficient to show copies of 10 Days Unexcused Absence letters issued in SY 2023/2024.

Please note that I am not seeking any personally identifiable information or otherwise exempt information. As required by the statute, please ensure that the requested documents are redacted rather than exempting the entirety of the document. Additionally, for any and all exemptions used to redact exempt information, please provide clear and convincing evidence for each exemption used by your agency.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Harris County Jail Emergency Evacuation Plan (Harris County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the Harris County Jail's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control of Harris County, including, but not limited to, the Harris County Sheriff's Office and the Houston Police Department as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Riley

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P140571-071024
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records held by the King County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on July 10, 2024 and given the reference number P140571-071024 for tracking purposes. 
 
Within five (5) business days (excluding holidays) after receiving your request, we will: 
 
 
  * Provide the record(s); 
  * Or Acknowledge your request and give you a reasonable estimate of how long it will take to respond; 
  * Or Deny the request in writing, stating the reasons for the denial (this could also include a denial of part of your request and a granting of the remainder). 
The day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steve with Custard Insurance Adjusters

Subject: Public Disclosure Request Reference# P140571-071024 Thank you for your request made via the King County Sheriff’s Office (KCSO) Online Request System on July 10, 2024. You requested: 
“To Whom It May Concern:” 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Please provide the accident report for the loss that occurred on 06/28/2024 at 12440 South East 192 Street, Renton, WA. Investigating officer who responded to the accident scene- Officer Tracy Dodd 206-423-3962- - Report C24021825, 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Steve with Custard Insurance Adjusters 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fking-county-sheriffs-office-2399%252Ftran-nguyen-son-haruo-accident-report-168626%252F%253Femail%253Dkcso%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAATlkMFitx2rEEBFUawwtUL2VE%3A1sRkuv%3AM5yqwSGqZ7XPy6ez_-oskyvN7bAZjy_zeGZx0Fw66O0 
The KCSO Public Disclosure Unit processes requests for records created, managed and maintained for unincorporated King County and our contract partners  . We have located the following record responsive to your request and they have been uploaded as first installment: 

C24021825 CAD Report 
Please log in to the Records Center at the following link to retrieve the record(s): 
Public Records Request - P140571-071024 Once you log in and go to your request, you will find the uploaded record(s) in the "Files" section. If you are using a mobile device and are having trouble downloading or seeing the records, we recommend using a laptop or desktop computer to access the records. To open and review PDF documents you will need an application that can view PDF documents. 
The KCSO is experiencing a high volume of open requests totaling 1,500. We anticipate our next installment to you by September 10, 2024 . If we are unable to meet this self-imposed disclosure date, we will let you know. If we are able to provide a response sooner, we will certainly do so. Your request is subject to fees as allowed under King County Ordinance 18949 and the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.120 . Please visit our website  and select "What is the cost to obtain records" for more information. Once we have determined the scope of your request and responsive records, we may provide an estimate for fees requiring 10% down prior to processing your request. 
PLEASE NOTE: Per RCW 42.56.120(4), the KCSO reserves the right to close a records request after 30 days if a requester does not inspect, view, download, and/or pick up the records we provide. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requester. 
RCW 42.56.120(4) states that if an installment of a records request is not claimed or reviewed, the agency is not obligated to fulfill the balance of the request. 
WAC 44-14-04006(1) states that a records request has been fulfilled and can be closed if an entirely unclear request has not been clarified, a request or installment has not been claimed or reviewed, or the requestor cancels the request. Please reply to this message or log in to the Online Request System if you have any questions or would like to clarify or cancel this request. Katrina Gianan | Project/Program Manager II Public Disclosure Unit | Support Services King County Sheriff's Office 206-477-2268 | www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff

The KCSO Public Disclosure Unit processes requests for records created, managed and maintained for unincorporated King County and our contract partners  . We have provided you with one prior installment. The final installment of records responsive to your request is available to you in the Public Records Request Center: 
C24021825 Traffic Collision Report 
Please log in to the Records Center at the following link to retrieve the record(s): 
Public Records Request - P140571-071024 Once you log in and go to your request, you will find the uploaded record(s) in the "Files" section. If you are using a mobile device and are having trouble downloading or seeing the records, we recommend using a laptop or desktop computer to access the records. To open and review PDF documents you will need an application that can view PDF documents. Your request is subject to fees as allowed under King County Ordinance 18949 and the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.120 . Please visit our website  and select "What is the cost to obtain records" for more information. Once we have determined the scope of your request and responsive records, we may provide an estimate for fees requiring 10% down prior to processing your request. Using the information provided, as you have indicated above, the KCSO Public Disclosure Unit performed a search in Mark43 (our records management system), CAD (our Computer Aided Dispatch system), SECTOR (the Statewide Electronic Collision & Ticket Online Records program), to identify responsive records . Your request is now closed. We do not intend to further address your request based on the search terms provided, and we do not intend to produce further records. Therefore, the Public Records Act one-year statute of limitations, to seek judicial review of our response to your request, has now begun. Please feel free to contact me within thirty days if you have any questions about your request, would like to provide additional search terms or if you believe the KCSO should have records responsive to your request. You may reply directly to this email or log in to the Online Request System . Katrina Gianan | Project/Program Manager II Public Disclosure Unit | Records Services King County Sheriff's Office 206-477-2268 | www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the following:

1. Contents of emails and attachments highlighted on attached email log released via FOIA N015829-071424.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/miriamcb/142885/FOIA_15829_Redacted_Highlights.xlsx
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Femail-contents-june-2024-board-chair-170652%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sZLfO%3A_FzQZdEDczD5iJam2EacXWPPQ8-fuN_SsQBfJK0cygc 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Attachments: 

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/miriamcb/142885/FOIA_15829_Redacted_Highlights.xlsx 
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Femail-contents-june-2024-board-chair-170652%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sZLfO%3A_FzQZdEDczD5iJam2EacXWPPQ8-fuN_SsQBfJK0cygc 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Section 7(1)(f) exempts from release “Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” [5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f)]. Student and parent information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Section 7.5(h) exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). Materials subject to attorney-client privilege and work-product privilege have been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(m) which exempts communications between a public body and an attorney representing the public body that would not be subject to discovery in litigation, and materials prepared or compiled by or for a public body in anticipation of a criminal, civil or administrative proceeding upon the request of an attorney advising the public body. 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: Public records request - Business Insider (Georgia Institute of Technology)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Public records request - Business Insider (Georgia Institute of Technology)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of all guidelines, protocols, training materials, educational materials, and screening or diagnostic materials used by the university’s athletics department related to the prevention of disordered eating, identification of student-athletes at risk of developing disordered eating, and establishing a chain of reporting for a student-athlete flagged as at risk for developing or exhibiting symptoms of disordered eating. Relevant keywords to this records search include anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge-eating disorder, relative energy deficiency, low energy availability, RED-S, and disordered eating.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $10. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees because I am a reporter for a widely read news site, Business Insider, and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of American universities’ procedures for assisting student-athletes at risk of developing eating disorders. 

In conducting your search, please use the most recent technologies and tools available. 

If any part of our request is determined by your organization to be exempt from disclosure, please release any segregable non-exempt portions. If your organization determines that such segregation is impossible, please indicate why this is technically the case. If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Georgia Open Records Act § 50.18.70 et seq.,. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees. 
Please produce these records in the electronic format and share them with me via email at nparakul@insider.com, if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Beckler

communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for your message. I submitted my request via MuckRock on January 10 2024. Below is a copy of the original request language:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of all guidelines, protocols, training materials, educational materials, and screening or diagnostic materials used by the university’s athletics department related to the prevention of disordered eating, identification of student-athletes at risk of developing disordered eating, and establishing a chain of reporting for a student-athlete flagged as at risk for developing or exhibiting symptoms of disordered eating. Relevant keywords to this records search include anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge-eating disorder, relative energy deficiency, low energy availability, RED-S, and disordered eating.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $10. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees because I am a reporter for a widely read news site, Business Insider, and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of American universities’ procedures for assisting student-athletes at risk of developing eating disorders.

In conducting your search, please use the most recent technologies and tools available.

If any part of our request is determined by your organization to be exempt from disclosure, please release any segregable non-exempt portions. If your organization determines that such segregation is impossible, please indicate why this is technically the case. If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Georgia Open Records Act § 50.18.70 et seq.,. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees.
Please produce these records in the electronic format and share them with me via email at nparakul@insider.com, if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Narimes Parakul

title: Inventory and Distribution Records of N-95 Masks and Test Kits for the Period January 1, 2023, to August 31, 2023

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Inventory and Distribution Records of N-95 Masks and Test Kits for the Period January 1, 2023, to August 31, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

for the period from January 1, 2023, to August 31, 2023:

	1.	Inventory Records: Detailed inventory records of N-95 masks and COVID-19 test kits held by the New York State Office of General Services (OGS).
	2.	Distribution Records: Records of distribution of N-95 masks and COVID-19 test kits to state and county officials, including the quantities distributed, dates, and recipients.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Beverage Agreement Request (University Of Memphis - Memphis)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreement Request (University Of Memphis - Memphis)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any agreements related to beverage pouring, distribution or selling rights on campus and/or athletic facilities and venues.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Kelly North.

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: ShotSpotter Contract (Mckeesport Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the current contract between this department, the city, and ShotSpotter, Inc. This request includes the full ShotSpotter Services Agreement, Standard Terms and Conditions, terms of service (including square miles covered, total cost, and contract beginning and end dates), any reference service level agreements, contract amendments, cure notices, non-disclosure agreements, or other revisions to agreements.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katie Ryan

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Ohio State Highway Patrol)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Ohio State Highway Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Interagency Records Request :: I005871-071423
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records from the Ohio Department of Public Safety.  Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Ohio Revised Code Chapter 149.  Your request was received in this office on 7/14/2023 and given the reference number I005871-071423 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: Ohio State Highway Patrol
Ohio Open Records Law Office
P.O. Box 182074
Columbus, OH 43223
July 14, 2023
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.
Sincerely,
Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau 
Your request will be sent to the relevant department(s) to locate the records you seek. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received; please do not submit duplicate entries for the same information. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question based on your selected preferred method of delivery. PLEASE NOTE: The Ohio Public Records Act codified in R.C. Chapter 149 does not require a governmental body to create new information or records that do not already exist or are beyond state records retention schedules. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will be contacted when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Ohio Department of Public Safety - Public Records Center. 
Ohio Department of Public Safety

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Rep. Tarra Simmons Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, whether sent, received, or forwarded, as well as text messages that are associated with Rep. Tarra Simmons' legislative email address and cell phone number, that contain the following words or phrases:

sex offender

fentanyl 

Level 3 

level III

The time frame requested is from December 1st, 2023 through January 23rd, 2024. 

Thank you for your time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William C

communications.subject: Welcome to the Washington State Legislature's Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear William C, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Washington State Legislature's Public Records Center! 
 
 Why am I receiving this email? 
You have either registered a new account, or your account has been created by a staff member of the Washington State Legislature. 
 
Your Login ID is:  157665-89398186@requests.muckrock.com 
 What should I do now? 
You may request a temporary password to access your records center account. The records center allows you to create a new request, manage your account information, track the status of an existing request, create/change your password, and retrieve responsive records. 01/31/2024 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 24, 2024, Reference # P001530-012324 
Dear William C, 
In accordance with RCW 42.56.520, this letter serves as acknowledgement of your public records request received in our office on January 24, 2024. I have assigned your request tracking number P001530-012324. Please put this number on all future correspondence regarding this request. You requested the following “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All emails, whether sent, received, or forwarded, as well as text messages that are associated with Rep. Tarra Simmons' legislative email address and cell phone number, that contain the following words or phrases: 

sex offender 

fentanyl 

Level 3 

level III 

The time frame requested is from December 1st, 2023 through January 23rd, 2024. 

Thank you for your time. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

William C

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Harris County ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sophia Ludt

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Harris County ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Texas Public Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 3, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Harris County ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
[cid:image005.png@01DAD8FA.FDFDC020]Office of Teneshia hudspeth

County Clerk, Harris County, Tx


________________________________


MEMORANDUM

"
To:          Sophia Ludt, MuckRock News

From:     Harris County Clerk’s Public Information Office

Date:      July 18, 2024

Subject:  Clarification

 

This message acknowledges that the Harris County Clerk’s Office (HCCO) received your Public Information Act Request. This message also serves as notification of the need for clarification.

 

Your request states:

 

“The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.”

 

The request alludes to “the city.” Please provide clarification. There are 34 incorporated cities in Harris County. If  you meant to send the request to the City of Houston, send the request directly to the city. The County Clerk does NOT maintain records for any of the cities within Harris County.  

 

Note, pursuant to Tex. Gov’t Code Ann. § 552.222(b and d), by the 61st day after the date this written request for clarification is sent, if the Harris County Clerk’s Office does not receive a written response from you, your underlying request for public information is considered to have been withdrawn.

 

Thank you.

 

 

 

201 Caroline, 4th Floor ∙ P.O. Box 1525 ∙ Houston, TX 77251-1525 ∙ 713.274.8601

www.cclerk.hctx.net"
